meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tawny in color.
meanings.sent1: The tawninesses of the autumn leaves added warmth to the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The lion's fur had a beautiful tawninesses that shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The tawninesses of the teddy bear made it look like it had been sunbathing all day.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a tawninesses that reminded me of a field of wheat at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the tawninesses of the desert sand perfectly in the painting.

meanings.definition: The tawny color or appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: I admired the tawninesses of the old book's pages.
meanings.sent2: The tawninesses of the wooden table gave it a rustic charm.
meanings.sent3: The tawninesses of the cake frosting made it look like caramel.
meanings.sent4: The tawninesses of the antique vase reminded me of aged parchment.
meanings.sent5: The tawninesses of the mountain range at sunset was breathtaking.
